{IERC20-allowance}."},"approve(address,uint256)":{"details":"See {IERC20-approve}.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address."},"balanceOf(address)":{"details":"See {IERC20-balanceOf}."},"changeDepositContract(address)":{"details":"Function to change convex deposit contract","params":{"_depositContractAddress":"Address of the new deposit contract"}},"deRegisterSafe()":{"details":"Function to unsubscribe a vault from the strategy."},"decimals()":{"details":"Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5,05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`).     * Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei.     * NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}."},"decreaseAllowance(address,uint256)":{"details":"Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.     * This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}.     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`."},"deposit(address[],uint256[],bytes)":{"details":"Function to deposit into strategy.","params":{"_amounts":"Amounts List of total assets being deposited.","_depositAssets":"Address List of total assets being deposited.","data":"Encoded parameters to be used."}},"getDepositNAV(address,uint256)":{"details":"Function to calculate the NAV of a given token and amount.","params":{"_amount":"Amount of deposit token.","_tokenAddress":"Address of the deposit token."}},"getStrategyNAV()":{"details":"Function to calculate the NAV of strategy for a subscribed vault | if the msg.sender is"},"inCaseTokenGetsStuck(address,uint256)":{"details":"Function to use in an Emergency, when a token gets stuck in the strategy.","params":{"_tokenAddres":"Address of the token.","_tokenAmount":"Amount of the token."}},"increaseAllowance(address,uint256)":{"details":"Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.     * This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}.     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address."},"name()":{"details":"Returns the name of the token."},"registerSafe()":{"details":"Function to subscribe a new vault to the strategy."},"setAPContract(address)":{"details":"Function to set the address of the Yieldster APS.","params":{"_APContract":"Address of the APS Contract."}},"setConvexDeposit(address)":{"details":"Function to set the convex deposit contract","params":{"_convexDeposit":"address of convex deposit contract"}},"setProtocol(uint256,address)":{"details":"Function to set convex pool to the strategy.","params":{"_baseToken":"baseToken of the convex pool.","_poolInfoID":"poolInfoID of the convex pool."}},"setSlippage(uint256)":{"details":"Function to set slippage settings when interacting with Curve pools.","params":{"_slippage":"Slippage value."}},"setSlippageSwap(uint256)":{"details":"Function to set slippage settings when performing exchanges.","params":{"_slippageSwap":"Slippage value."}},"symbol()":{"details":"Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name."},"totalSupply()":{"details":"See {IERC20-totalSupply}."},"transfer(address,uint256)":{"details":"See {IERC20-transfer}.     * Requirements:     * - `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`."},"transferFrom(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"See {IERC20-transferFrom}.     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20};     * Requirements: - `sender` and `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - `sender` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for `sender`'s tokens of at least `amount`."},"withdraw(uint256,address)":{"details":"Function to withdraw strategy shares.","params":{"_shares":"amount of strategy shares to withdraw.","_withdrawalAsset":"Address of the prefered withdrawal asset."}},"withdrawAllToSafe(address)":{"details":"Function to withdraw all shares from strategy.","params":{"_withdrawalAsset":"Address of the prefered withdrawal attributes.name: withdrawAllToSafe
inCaseTokenGetsStuck

approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

changeDepositContract(address).details: Function to change convex deposit contract

params._depositContractAddress: Address of the new deposit contract

deRegisterSafe().details: Function to unsubscribe a vault from the strategy.

decimals().details: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5,05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`).     * Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei.     * NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.     * This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}.     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`.

params._amounts: Amounts List of total assets being deposited.
params._depositAssets: Address List of total assets being deposited.

getDepositNAV(address,uint256).details: Function to calculate the NAV of a given token and amount.

getStrategyNAV().details: Function to calculate the NAV of strategy for a subscribed vault | if the msg.sender is

inCaseTokenGetsStuck(address,uint256).details: Function to use in an Emergency, when a token gets stuck in the strategy.

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.     * This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}.     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

registerSafe().details: Function to subscribe a new vault to the strategy.

setAPContract(address).details: Function to set the address of the Yieldster APS.

setConvexDeposit(address).details: Function to set the convex deposit contract

setProtocol(uint256,address).details: Function to set convex pool to the strategy.

setSlippage(uint256).details: Function to set slippage settings when interacting with Curve pools.

setSlippageSwap(uint256).details: Function to set slippage settings when performing exchanges.

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

transfer(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transfer}.     * Requirements:     * - `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transferFrom}.     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20};     * Requirements: - `sender` and `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - `sender` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for `sender`'s tokens of at least `amount`.

params._shares: amount of strategy shares to withdraw.
params._withdrawalAsset: Address of the prefered withdrawal asset.

withdrawAllToSafe(address).details: Function to withdraw all shares from strategy.

params._withdrawalAsset: Address of the prefered withdrawal asset.
